# 
# 

\begin{tabular}{ll}
[MODE] & NormalTimeMode:PresstochangetoAlarmMode AllModes:PresstochangetoNormalTimeMode. \\
[TIMER] & PresstochangethedisplaytoCountdownTimerMode. \\
[SET] & Presstoentersettingmodesandtoselectitemsforsetting \\
[UP] & NormalTimeMode:Presstochangeto12-houror24-hour timedisplayformat. SetMode:Presstoincreasevalues. AlarmMode:Presstoactivateanddeactivatethealarmand snoozefunctions. \\
[DOWN] & NormalTimeMode:Presstochangetemperature displaytodegreesFahrenheit(F)orCelsius(C). SetMode:Presstodecreasevalues. AlarmMode:Presstoactivateanddeactivatethealarm andsnoozefunctions. \\
\end{tabular}


\*IntheNormalTimeModetheclockwilldisplaythecurrenttime,month,date,day of theweekand temperature."TIME"will appearinthetopof thedisplay. 
# 
1.Remove theplasticinsulator extendingoutof thebatterycoveronthebackof theclock.   
2.Thealarmmelodywillplaywhenthebatteriesarefirst installedoractivated. Pressanybuttontosilencethealarm. 
# 
1.In theNormal TIMEModePressthe[SET]button toenterthesettingmode. “"TIME"andthehourwillflashinthedisplay.   
2.Thesettingsequenceis:Hour $>$ Minutes $>$ Year $>$ Month $>$ Date $>$ Exit.Use the[SET]buttontoadvancethroughthesettingsandusethe[UP]and [DOWN]buttonstomakeadjustments.Pressandholdthebuttonsforfast setting. 
# 
1.Pressthe[MODE]buttontoentertheAlarmMode.Abelliconwillapearinthe display.   
2.The setting sequenceis:Hour $>$ Minutes $>$ SnoozeMinutes(1-60minutes) $>$ AlarmMelody $>$ Exit.Usethe[SET]buttontoadvancethroughthesettingsand use the[UP] and [down] buttons to make adjustments.   
3Whenfinished,pressthe[MODE]buttontoreturn to theTIMEmode. 
# 
1.Pressthe[MoDE]buttontoentertheAlarmMode.   
2.Pressthe[UP] and[DowN]buttonstoactivatethealarmfunction.   
3.When thealarm ison,the alarm,icon,(-)，will appearin thedisplay.   
4.Thealarmwillsoundatthesetalarmtimeeachdayforoneminute.Pressany   
buttontosilencethealarmbeforethen.

# 
1.Press[MODE] to enter the AlarmMode.   
2.Pressthe[UP] and[DoWN]buttons toactivate the alarm and snoozefunctions   
3.When the snooze is on the snooze icon, $Z^{z}$ will appearinthedisplay.   
4.The alarmwill soundat theset alarm timefor1minute andwillsnooze for the set numberof snoozeminutes(1-60)and then sound againfor1 minute.This cyclewillrepeattwice.   
5.When the alarm is sounding,press any buttonexcept the[SET]button to temporarilysilencethealarm.Thesnoozeicon, $Z^{z}$ willflashinthedisplay indicatingthatthesnoozefunctionisstillactive.   
6.Press the[SET] buttontocancel the snoozecycleand silence the alarm at anytime. 
# 
1.Press the[TIMER] button to enter thecountdown timer mode.“TIMER”will appearinthedisplay.   
2.Press the[SET] button to enter the setting mode."TIMER"and the hour willflash in the display.   
3.The seting sequence is: Hour $>$ Minutes $>$ Seconds $>$ Exit. Use the [SET] button to advance through thesettings and use the[UP] and[DoWN] buttons tomakeadjustments.Themaximumcountdowntimeis23:59:59.   
4.Aftersetting,press the[TIMER]buttontostart andstopthecountdown timer.   
5.Press[MODE]toreturntothenormal TIMEdisplay.“TIMER"will appearinthe displaynext to“TiME”indicatingthat the timeriscounting down.   
6.When theset timehasexpired thealarmwill sound foroneminute.Press any buttontosilencethealarmbeforethen. 
# 
IntheNormal TIMEModepressthe[DOWN]buttontoselect $^\circ\mathsf{F}$ or $^\circ\mathtt{C}$ forthe temperaturedisplay. 
# 
In the Normal TIMEMode press the[UP] button toselect 12 or 24-hour time display. 
# 
1.Whenthedisplaybeginstofadeorthe alarmmelodybecomesweakordistorted this is the sign that it is time to replace the battery.   
2.Remove thebattery coverfrom thebackof theclock.   
3.Replacewithtwonew1.5voltAAAbatteriesaccordingtothediagraminthe batteryholder.Alkalinebatteriesarerecommendedforlongerlifeandbest performance.
